metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8790 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The EbmlUnicodeString::UpdateFromUTF8 function in libEBML before 1.3.3 allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from process heap memory via a crafted UTF-8 string, which triggers an invalid memory access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libebml4 - 1.3.0-2+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> mkvtoolnix contains an embedded copy of libebml, but it looks like it uses the system version of it

criterions.comment: libebml package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-2+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
